intro: Xanthophytum capitatum, commonly known as the goldenhead plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. Xanthophytum capitatum typically grows in dry, arid environments and is adapted to thrive in harsh conditions. Its botanical structure includes fibrous roots and narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss.
